toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: Build and Deploy Documentation

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_mode:
        description: 'Build mode'
        required: false
        default: 'full'
        type: choice
        options:
          - quick
          - full

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Quick validation - runs first to fail fast
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 15
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get

      - name: Build Lean project (fail fast)
        run: lake build

  # Fast build - just landing page and GIFs
  build-landing:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied successfully"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: List landing page contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Landing page deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f

      - name: Upload landing page artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Deploy landing page immediately
  deploy-landing:
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-landing
    steps:
      - name: Deploy landing page to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Full build - everything including docs and blueprint
  # Only runs on manual workflow_dispatch with build_mode='full'
  build-full:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get || true

      - name: Build Lean project
        run: lake build

      # Build API Documentation
      - name: Build API documentation
        run: |
          # Build documentation using the correct command
          lake build ChebyshevCircles:docs
          # doc-gen4 outputs to .lake/build/doc
          mkdir -p _site/docs
          if [ -d ".lake/build/doc" ]; then
            cp -r .lake/build/doc/* _site/docs/
            echo "API documentation built successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: API documentation not found after build"
            exit 1
          fi

      # Build Blueprint
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
          cache: 'pip'

      - name: Install system dependencies
        run: |
          sudo apt-get update
          sudo apt-get install -y graphviz libgraphviz-dev \
            texlive-latex-base \
            texlive-latex-extra \
            texlive-fonts-recommended \
            texlive-fonts-extra \
            texlive-science \
            texlive-xetex \
            latexmk

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: pip install -r blueprint/requirements.txt

      - name: Patch plastexdepgraph for hashable nodes
        run: python3 .github/scripts/patch_plastexdepgraph.py

      - name: Build blueprint (web)
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint web
          echo "=== Blueprint web build output ==="
          ls -la src/web/ || echo "WARNING: web directory not found"
          find src/web -type f | head -20 || true

      - name: Build blueprint (pdf)
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint pdf || echo "PDF generation failed, continuing with web version only"
          echo "=== Blueprint PDF build output ==="
          ls -la print/ || echo "WARNING: print directory not found"
          if [ -f "print/print.pdf" ]; then
            echo "PDF successfully generated: $(ls -lh print/print.pdf)"
          else
            echo "PDF not generated"
          fi

      - name: Check declarations
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint checkdecls || echo "Some declarations could not be verified"

      - name: Copy blueprint to deployment directory
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/blueprint
          if [ -d "blueprint/src/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/src/web)" ]; then
            cp -r blueprint/src/web/* _site/blueprint/
            echo "Blueprint web files copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Blueprint web build not found or empty"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create dependency graph redirect page
        run: |
          # Create redirect page to blueprint's interactive dependency graph
          bash .github/scripts/create_graph_page.sh _site/graph
          echo "Dependency graph redirect page created (points to /blueprint/dep_graph_document.html)"

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied to full deployment"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List full deployment contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Full deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f | head -50

      - name: Upload full site artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-full'

  # Deploy full site
  deploy-full:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-full
    steps:
      - name: Deploy full site to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-full'

Since `gh` CLI isn't available, here are your options:

## Option 1: Manual Trigger (Quick Fix)

Go to GitHub Actions and manually trigger a full deployment:

1. Visit: https://github.com/e-vergo/ChebyshevCircles/actions/workflows/deploy.yml
2. Click "Run workflow" button
3. Select "full" from the "Build mode" dropdown
4. Click "Run workflow"

This will run the full build (~35-45 min) and deploy everything: docs, blueprint, and paper.

## Option 2: Auto-Deploy Docs on Push (Better for Showcase)

Since this is a showcase repository, we probably want docs/blueprint always up-to-date. I can modify the workflow to build docs on every push to main, while still keeping the manual full option.

**Which would you prefer?**

1. **Manual trigger only** - Keep current setup, you manually trigger full builds when needed
2. **Auto-deploy on main** - Every push to main builds and deploys everything (slower CI but always current)
3. **Hybrid** - Quick workflow deploys paper + landing page, separate scheduled job updates docs/blueprint periodically

My recommendation: **Option 2** for a showcase repository. The CI will take 35-45 minutes instead of 5-12, but everything will always be up-to-date when people visit.

name: Build and Deploy Documentation

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_mode:
        description: 'Build mode'
        required: false
        default: 'full'
        type: choice
        options:
          - quick
          - full

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Quick validation - runs first to fail fast
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 15
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get

      - name: Build Lean project (fail fast)
        run: lake build

  # Fast build - just landing page and GIFs
  build-landing:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied successfully"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List landing page contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Landing page deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f

      - name: Upload landing page artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Deploy landing page immediately
  deploy-landing:
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-landing
    steps:
      - name: Deploy landing page to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Full build - everything including docs and blueprint
  # Only runs on manual workflow_dispatch with build_mode='full'
  build-full:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get || true

      - name: Build Lean project
        run: lake build

      # Build API Documentation
      - name: Build API documentation
        run: |
          # Build documentation using the correct command
          lake build ChebyshevCircles:docs
          # doc-gen4 outputs to .lake/build/doc
          mkdir -p _site/docs
          if [ -d ".lake/build/doc" ]; then
            cp -r .lake/build/doc/* _site/docs/
            echo "API documentation built successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: API documentation not found after build"
            exit 1
          fi

      # Build Blueprint
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
          cache: 'pip'

      - name: Install system dependencies
        run: |
          sudo apt-get update
          sudo apt-get install -y graphviz libgraphviz-dev \
            texlive-latex-base \
            texlive-latex-extra \
            texlive-fonts-recommended \
            texlive-fonts-extra \
            texlive-science \
            texlive-xetex \
            latexmk

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: pip install -r blueprint/requirements.txt

      - name: Patch plastexdepgraph for hashable nodes
        run: python3 .github/scripts/patch_plastexdepgraph.py

      - name: Build blueprint (web)
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint web
          echo "=== Blueprint web build output ==="
          ls -la src/web/ || echo "WARNING: web directory not found"
          find src/web -type f | head -20 || true

      - name: Build blueprint (pdf)
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint pdf || echo "PDF generation failed, continuing with web version only"
          echo "=== Blueprint PDF build output ==="
          ls -la print/ || echo "WARNING: print directory not found"
          if [ -f "print/print.pdf" ]; then
            echo "PDF successfully generated: $(ls -lh print/print.pdf)"
          else
            echo "PDF not generated"
          fi

      - name: Check declarations
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint checkdecls || echo "Some declarations could not be verified"

      - name: Copy blueprint to deployment directory
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/blueprint
          if [ -d "blueprint/src/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/src/web)" ]; then
            cp -r blueprint/src/web/* _site/blueprint/
            echo "Blueprint web files copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Blueprint web build not found or empty"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create dependency graph redirect page
        run: |
          # Create redirect page to blueprint's interactive dependency graph
          bash .github/scripts/create_graph_page.sh _site/graph
          echo "Dependency graph redirect page created (points to /blueprint/dep_graph_document.html)"

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied to full deployment"

      - name: Copy visualization videos

name: Build and Deploy Documentation

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_mode:
        description: 'Build mode'
        required: false
        default: 'full'
        type: choice
        options:
          - quick
          - full

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Quick validation - runs first to fail fast
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 15
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get

      - name: Build Lean project (fail fast)
        run: lake build

  # Fast build - just landing page and GIFs
  build-landing:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied successfully"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List landing page contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Landing page deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f

      - name: Upload landing page artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Deploy landing page immediately
  deploy-landing:
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-landing
    steps:
      - name: Deploy landing page to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Full build - everything including docs and blueprint
  # Runs on every push to main, or manual workflow_dispatch with build_mode='full'
  build-full:
    if: (github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push') || (github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full')
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get || true

      - name: Build Lean project
        run: lake build

      # Build API Documentation
      - name: Build API documentation
        run: |
          # Build documentation using the correct command
          lake build ChebyshevCircles:docs
          # doc-gen4 outputs to .lake/build/doc
          mkdir -p _site/docs
          if [ -d ".lake/build/doc" ]; then
            cp -r .lake/build/doc/* _site/docs/
            echo "API documentation built successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: API documentation not found after build"
            exit 1
          fi

      # Build Blueprint
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
          cache: 'pip'

      - name: Install system dependencies
        run: |
          sudo apt-get update
          sudo apt-get install -y graphviz libgraphviz-dev \
            texlive-latex-base \
            texlive-latex-extra \
            texlive-fonts-recommended \
            texlive-fonts-extra \
            texlive-science \
            texlive-xetex \
            latexmk

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: pip install -r blueprint/requirements.txt

      - name: Patch plastexdepgraph for hashable nodes
        run: python3 .github/scripts/patch_plastexdepgraph.py

      - name: Build blueprint (web)
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint web
          echo "=== Blueprint web build output ==="
          ls -la src/web/ || echo "WARNING: web directory not found"
          find src/web -type f | head -20 || true

      - name: Build blueprint (pdf)
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint pdf || echo "PDF generation failed, continuing with web version only"
          echo "=== Blueprint PDF build output ==="
          ls -la print/ || echo "WARNING: print directory not found"
          if [ -f "print/print.pdf" ]; then
            echo "PDF successfully generated: $(ls -lh print/print.pdf)"
          else
            echo "PDF not generated"
          fi

      - name: Check declarations
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint checkdecls || echo "Some declarations could not be verified"

      - name: Copy blueprint to deployment directory
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/blueprint
          if [ -d "blueprint/src/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/src/web)" ]; then
            cp -r blueprint/src/web/* _site/blueprint/
            echo "Blueprint web files copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Blueprint web build not found or empty"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create dependency graph redirect page
        run: |
          # Create redirect page to blueprint's interactive dependency graph
          bash .github/scripts/create_graph_page.sh _site/graph
          echo "Dependency graph redirect page created (points to /blueprint/dep_graph_document.html)"

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied to full deployment"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List full deployment contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Full deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f | head -50

      - name: Upload full site artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-full'

  # Deploy full site
  deploy-full:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-full
    steps:
      - name: Deploy full site to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-full'

content.thinking:
Good! Now I should also think about whether we still need the deploy-landing job. Since we're now deploying the full site on every push to main, the deploy-landing job will try to deploy at the same time, which could cause conflicts.

Let me check: both deploy-landing and deploy-full deploy to the same github-pages environment. GitHub Pages can only have one deployment at a time, so they'll conflict. I should disable the deploy-landing job when the full build runs.

Actually, looking at the workflow structure:
- validate runs first
- build-landing runs (needs: validate) 
- deploy-landing runs (needs: build-landing) - deploys landing page artifact
- build-full runs (needs: validate)
- deploy-full runs (needs: build-full) - deploys full artifact

Both deploy-landing and deploy-full will try to deploy to the same environment. The last one to complete will win. Since build-full takes much longer, deploy-full will happen after deploy-landing, so the full site will be what's deployed. But this is wasteful - we're building and deploying the landing page for no reason.

I should update deploy-landing to only run when build-full is NOT running. So:
- deploy-landing: run on pushes to main when build-full is NOT running (i.e., never now that build-full runs on all pushes)
- OR we could just remove the deploy-landing job entirely since full deployment includes everything

Actually, let me reconsider the whole flow. With the new setup:
- On push to main: validate → build-landing (fast) → deploy-landing (fast) → build-full (slow) → deploy-full (overwrites landing)

This is wasteful. Better approach:
- On push to main: validate → build-full → deploy-full (everything)
- build-landing is no longer needed for main branch pushes

But wait - PRs! PRs should still run the quick validation. Let me think about this:
- On PR: validate → build-landing (to verify landing page builds)


- On push to main: validate → build-full → deploy-full
- On manual trigger: depends on build_mode

I'll modify the workflow to ensure deploy-landing only triggers during pull request checks. This means limiting its scope to PR validation while keeping the main branch deployment streamlined and efficient. The goal is to avoid redundant builds and deployments while maintaining the ability to verify landing page functionality during code reviews.

file.content:
Chebyshev Circles

Blueprint Paper (PDF) API Docs Dependency Graph GitHub

Rotated Roots of Unity and Chebyshev Polynomials

Rotating the N-th roots of unity by angle φ and projecting them onto the real axis yields N points. The polynomial with these projections as roots, when scaled by 2N-1, equals the N-th Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind plus a constant that depends on φ.

Main Theorem

theorem rotated_roots_yield_chebyshev (N : ℕ) (φ : ℝ) (hN : 0 < N) :
  ∃ (c : ℝ), scaledPolynomial N φ = Polynomial.Chebyshev.T ℝ N + C c

View theorem statement in API docs →

Construction:
  • Projected roots: cos(φ + 2πk/N) for k = 0, ..., N-1 (blueprint §2)
  • Unscaled polynomial: P(x) = ∏(x - cos(φ + 2πk/N)) (blueprint §3)
  • Scaled polynomial: S(x) = 2N-1 · P(x) (blueprint §3)
  • Result: S(x) = TN(x) + c(φ) (blueprint §1)

Project Components

Formal Verification

Complete Lean 4 formalization across 10 modules with full proofs.

3,457
Lines of Proof
0
Sorry Statements
3
Axioms

Axioms: propext, Classical.choice, Quot.sound
Lean: v4.25.0-rc2
Mathlib: 96d8298

View API Documentation →

Blueprint

Interactive documentation showing dependency structure and formalization status.

Navigate through the proof architecture and see cross-references between mathematical exposition and Lean code.

Explore Blueprint →

Dependency Graph

Visual representation of how all lemmas, theorems, and definitions connect.

See the complete proof structure from foundational results to the main theorem.

View Dependency Graph →

Research Paper

Publication-ready mathematics paper (14 pages) with complete proofs in classical notation.

Traditional exposition targeting a general mathematical audience at graduate level.

Read Paper (PDF) →

Documentation Navigation

This formalization is documented across multiple interconnected resources. Each serves a distinct purpose in understanding the mathematical result, its formalization, and the proof architecture.

Complete Module Reference

The formalization is structured across 10 modules (3,457 lines total). Each module's API documentation contains the complete, type-checked Lean code:

  • RootsOfUnity (108 lines) - Root definitions and list properties
  • PolynomialConstruction (541 lines) - Polynomial construction from roots
  • TrigonometricIdentities (137 lines) - Trigonometric sum identities
  • ChebyshevRoots (235 lines) - Chebyshev root characterization
  • PowerSums (705 lines) - Power sum φ-invariance
  • NewtonIdentities (317 lines) - Newton's identities framework
  • PolynomialProperties (130 lines) - Polynomial degree and coefficient properties
  • PowerSumEquality (273 lines) - General power sum equality
  • ChebyshevOrthogonality (538 lines) - Discrete orthogonality relations
  • MainTheorem (473 lines) - Main theorem and supporting results

Quick Links to Major Results

Main Theorem: API Docs | Blueprint §1

Power Sum Invariance (φ-independence): API Docs | Blueprint §4

Discrete Orthogonality: sum_exp_chebyshev_angles | Module Docs | Blueprint §5

Newton's Identities Application: esymm_eq_of_psum_eq | Module Docs | Blueprint §6

Visual Proof Structure: The dependency graph provides an interactive visualization of all 200+ definitions, lemmas, and theorems, showing how foundational results in discrete orthogonality and polynomial algebra combine to establish the main theorem.

Proof Strategy

The verification establishes that rotated roots and Chebyshev roots share identical power sums for all positive degrees, which by Newton's identities implies they generate polynomials differing only by a constant term. This approach reduces the geometric claim to an algebraic invariant (power sums), then applies classical polynomial algebra to reach the conclusion.

Critical Proofs

Power Sum Invariance (powerSumCos_invariant): The cornerstone of the entire proof. This establishes that ∑cosm(φ + 2πk/N) is independent of the rotation angle φ for all m ≥ 1. The proof exploits the fact that cos(θ) = (eiθ + e-iθ)/2, converting cosine powers into sums of complex exponentials. These exponential sums telescope to zero by discrete orthogonality unless specific divisibility conditions hold, yielding the φ-independence. Without this result, there would be no connection between rotated roots and Chebyshev polynomials.

Discrete Orthogonality (ChebyshevOrthogonality module): Proves that ∑k=0N-1 exp(2πikm/N) = 0 for 0 < m < N and equals N when m = 0 or N divides m (see sum_exp_chebyshev_angles, sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes). This is the discrete analog of continuous Fourier orthogonality on the circle. The proof uses properties of geometric series and the fact that N-th roots of unity satisfy ωN = 1. This orthogonality is what causes most terms in the power sum expansion to vanish, leaving only the φ-independent contributions. It connects harmonic analysis (orthogonality relations) to polynomial root behavior.

Newton's Identities (NewtonIdentities module): Establishes the relationship between power sums of roots and elementary symmetric polynomials (coefficients) via multiset_newton_identity. Specifically, if two monic polynomials have roots with matching power sums S1, S2, ..., SN, then the polynomials have identical coefficients except possibly the constant term (esymm_eq_of_psum_eq). This is the bridge that converts power sum equality into polynomial equality up to a constant. The formalization handles the recursive structure of Newton's identities and proves the converse direction needed: power sum agreement implies coefficient agreement. This classical result from polynomial algebra is indispensable for connecting root properties to polynomial identity.

Getting Started

Prerequisites: Lean 4 (v4.25.0-rc2), basic familiarity with polynomials, complex numbers, and trigonometric identities.

Clone the repository and build the project:

git clone https://github.com/e-vergo/ChebyshevCircles.git
cd ChebyshevCircles
lake exe cache get
lake build

Read the research paper for traditional mathematical exposition, explore the Blueprint for an interactive map of the formalization, check the API Documentation for detailed proofs, or view the Dependency Graph to understand the proof structure.

input.new_string:
Read the research paper for traditional mathematical exposition, explore the Blueprint for an interactive map of the formalization, check the API Documentation for detailed proofs, or view the Dependency Graph to understand the proof structure.

Acknowledgments & Inspiration

🎓 Early Visualization

The Girls' Angle blog post "Chebyshev Polynomials of the First Kind" (December 2016) appears to be the first published visualization and animation of this geometric connection between rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev polynomials.

This foundational work demonstrated the visual beauty of the relationship years before this formal verification.

Prior Art

💡 Initial Inspiration

A Mastodon post by @acegikmo (November 2022) on visual patterns in rotated roots of unity sparked the investigation that led to this formalization.

Sometimes the most profound mathematical journeys begin with a single compelling visualization shared on social media.

Inspiration Source

Rotated Roots of Unity and Chebyshev Polynomials

Rotating the N-th roots of unity by angle φ and projecting them onto the real axis yields N points. The polynomial with these projections as roots, when scaled by 2N-1, equals the N-th Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind plus a constant that depends on φ.

Main Theorem

theorem rotated_roots_yield_chebyshev (N : ℕ) (φ : ℝ) (hN : 0 < N) :
  ∃ (c : ℝ), scaledPolynomial N φ = Polynomial.Chebyshev.T ℝ N + C c

View theorem statement in API docs →

Construction:
  • Projected roots: cos(φ + 2πk/N) for k = 0, ..., N-1 (blueprint §2)
  • Unscaled polynomial: P(x) = ∏(x - cos(φ + 2πk/N)) (blueprint §3)
  • Scaled polynomial: S(x) = 2N-1 · P(x) (blueprint §3)
  • Result: S(x) = TN(x) + c(φ) (blueprint §1)

Documentation Navigation

This formalization is documented across multiple interconnected resources. Each serves a distinct purpose in understanding the mathematical result, its formalization, and the proof architecture.

Complete Module Reference

The formalization is structured across 10 modules (3,457 lines total). Each module's API documentation contains the complete, type-checked Lean code:

  • RootsOfUnity (108 lines) - Root definitions and list properties
  • PolynomialConstruction (541 lines) - Polynomial construction from roots
  • TrigonometricIdentities (137 lines) - Trigonometric sum identities
  • ChebyshevRoots (235 lines) - Chebyshev root characterization
  • PowerSums (705 lines) - Power sum φ-invariance
  • NewtonIdentities (317 lines) - Newton's identities framework
  • PolynomialProperties (130 lines) - Polynomial degree and coefficient properties
  • PowerSumEquality (273 lines) - General power sum equality
  • ChebyshevOrthogonality (538 lines) - Discrete orthogonality relations
  • MainTheorem (473 lines) - Main theorem and supporting results

Quick Links to Major Results

Main Theorem: API Docs | Blueprint §1

Power Sum Invariance (φ-independence): API Docs | Blueprint §4

Discrete Orthogonality: sum_exp_chebyshev_angles | Module Docs | Blueprint §5

Newton's Identities Application: esymm_eq_of_psum_eq | Module Docs | Blueprint §6

Visual Proof Structure: The dependency graph provides an interactive visualization of all 200+ definitions, lemmas, and theorems, showing how foundational results in discrete orthogonality and polynomial algebra combine to establish the main theorem.

Proof Strategy

The verification establishes that rotated roots and Chebyshev roots share identical power sums for all positive degrees, which by Newton's identities implies they generate polynomials differing only by a constant term. This approach reduces the geometric claim to an algebraic invariant (power sums), then applies classical polynomial algebra to reach the conclusion.

Critical Proofs

Power Sum Invariance (powerSumCos_invariant): The cornerstone of the entire proof. This establishes that ∑cosm(φ + 2πk/N) is independent of the rotation angle φ for all m ≥ 1. The proof exploits the fact that cos(θ) = (eiθ + e-iθ)/2, converting cosine powers into sums of complex exponentials. These exponential sums telescope to zero by discrete orthogonality unless specific divisibility conditions hold, yielding the φ-independence. Without this result, there would be no connection between rotated roots and Chebyshev polynomials.

Discrete Orthogonality (ChebyshevOrthogonality module): Proves that ∑k=0N-1 exp(2πikm/N) = 0 for 0 < m < N and equals N when m = 0 or N divides m (see sum_exp_chebyshev_angles, sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes). This is the discrete analog of continuous Fourier orthogonality on the circle. The proof uses properties of geometric series and the fact that N-th roots of unity satisfy ωN = 1. This orthogonality is what causes most terms in the power sum expansion to vanish, leaving only the φ-independent contributions. It connects harmonic analysis (orthogonality relations) to polynomial root behavior.

Newton's Identities (NewtonIdentities module): Establishes the relationship between power sums of roots and elementary symmetric polynomials (coefficients) via multiset_newton_identity. Specifically, if two monic polynomials have roots with matching power sums S1, S2, ..., SN, then the polynomials have identical coefficients except possibly the constant term (esymm_eq_of_psum_eq). This is the bridge that converts power sum equality into polynomial equality up to a constant. The formalization handles the recursive structure of Newton's identities and proves the converse direction needed: power sum agreement implies coefficient agreement. This classical result from polynomial algebra is indispensable for connecting root properties to polynomial identity.

Getting Started

Prerequisites: Lean 4 (v4.25.0-rc2), basic familiarity with polynomials, complex numbers, and trigonometric identities.

Clone the repository and build the project:

git clone https://github.com/e-vergo/ChebyshevCircles.git
cd ChebyshevCircles
lake exe cache get
lake build

Read the research paper for traditional mathematical exposition, explore the Blueprint for an interactive map of the formalization, check the API Documentation for detailed proofs, or view the Dependency Graph to understand the proof structure.

Acknowledgments & Inspiration

🎓 Early Visualization

The Girls' Angle blog post "Chebyshev Polynomials of the First Kind" (December 2016) appears to be the first published visualization and animation of this geometric connection between rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev polynomials.

This foundational work demonstrated the visual beauty of the relationship years before this formal verification.

Prior Art

💡 Initial Inspiration

A Mastodon post by @acegikmo (November 2022) on visual patterns in rotated roots of unity sparked the investigation that led to this formalization.

Sometimes the most profound mathematical journeys begin with a single compelling visualization shared on social media.

Inspiration Source

toolUseResult.originalFile:
Chebyshev Circles

Blueprint Paper (PDF) API Docs Dependency Graph GitHub

Rotated Roots of Unity and Chebyshev Polynomials

Rotating the N-th roots of unity by angle φ and projecting them onto the real axis yields N points. The polynomial with these projections as roots, when scaled by 2N-1, equals the N-th Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind plus a constant that depends on φ.

Main Theorem

theorem rotated_roots_yield_chebyshev (N : ℕ) (φ : ℝ) (hN : 0 < N) :
  ∃ (c : ℝ), scaledPolynomial N φ = Polynomial.Chebyshev.T ℝ N + C c

View theorem statement in API docs →

Construction:
  • Projected roots: cos(φ + 2πk/N) for k = 0, ..., N-1 (blueprint §2)
  • Unscaled polynomial: P(x) = ∏(x - cos(φ + 2πk/N)) (blueprint §3)
  • Scaled polynomial: S(x) = 2N-1 · P(x) (blueprint §3)
  • Result: S(x) = TN(x) + c(φ) (blueprint §1)

Project Components

Formal Verification

Complete Lean 4 formalization across 10 modules with full proofs.

Research Paper

Publication-ready mathematics paper (14 pages) with complete proofs in classical notation.

Traditional exposition targeting a general mathematical audience at graduate level.

Read Paper (PDF) →

Documentation Navigation

This formalization is documented across multiple interconnected resources. Each serves a distinct purpose in understanding the mathematical result, its formalization, and the proof architecture.

Complete Module Reference

The formalization is structured across 10 modules (3,498 lines total). Each module's API documentation contains the complete, type-checked Lean code:

  • RootsOfUnity (108 lines) - Root definitions and list properties
  • PolynomialConstruction (541 lines) - Polynomial construction from roots
  • TrigonometricIdentities (137 lines) - Trigonometric sum identities
  • ChebyshevRoots (235 lines) - Chebyshev root characterization
  • PowerSums (705 lines) - Power sum φ-invariance
  • NewtonIdentities (317 lines) - Newton's identities framework
  • PolynomialProperties (130 lines) - Polynomial degree and coefficient properties
  • PowerSumEquality (273 lines) - General power sum equality
  • ChebyshevOrthogonality (538 lines) - Discrete orthogonality relations
  • MainTheorem (473 lines) - Main theorem and supporting results

Quick Links to Major Results

Main Theorem: API Docs | Blueprint §1

Power Sum Invariance (φ-independence): API Docs | Blueprint §4

Discrete Orthogonality: sum_exp_chebyshev_angles | Module Docs | Blueprint §5

Newton's Identities Application: esymm_eq_of_psum_eq | Module Docs | Blueprint §6

Visual Proof Structure: The dependency graph provides an interactive visualization of all 200+ definitions, lemmas, and theorems, showing how foundational results in discrete orthogonality and polynomial algebra combine to establish the main theorem.

Proof Strategy

The verification establishes that rotated roots and Chebyshev roots share identical power sums for all positive degrees, which by Newton's identities implies they generate polynomials differing only by a constant term. This approach reduces the geometric claim to an algebraic invariant (power sums), then applies classical polynomial algebra to reach the conclusion.

Critical Proofs

Power Sum Invariance (powerSumCos_invariant): The cornerstone of the entire proof. This establishes that ∑cosm(φ + 2πk/N) is independent of the rotation angle φ for all m ≥ 1. The proof exploits the fact that cos(θ) = (eiθ + e-iθ)/2, converting cosine powers into sums of complex exponentials. These exponential sums telescope to zero by discrete orthogonality unless specific divisibility conditions hold, yielding the φ-independence. Without this result, there would be no connection between rotated roots and Chebyshev polynomials.

Discrete Orthogonality (ChebyshevOrthogonality module): Proves that ∑k=0N-1 exp(2πikm/N) = 0 for 0 < m < N and equals N when m = 0 or N divides m (see sum_exp_chebyshev_angles, sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes). This is the discrete analog of continuous Fourier orthogonality on the circle. The proof uses properties of geometric series and the fact that N-th roots of unity satisfy ωN = 1. This orthogonality is what causes most terms in the power sum expansion to vanish, leaving only the φ-independent contributions. It connects harmonic analysis (orthogonality relations) to polynomial root behavior.

Newton's Identities (NewtonIdentities module): Establishes the relationship between power sums of roots and elementary symmetric polynomials (coefficients) via multiset_newton_identity. Specifically, if two monic polynomials have roots with matching power sums S1, S2, ..., SN, then the polynomials have identical coefficients except possibly the constant term (esymm_eq_of_psum_eq). This is the bridge that converts power sum equality into polynomial equality up to a constant. The formalization handles the recursive structure of Newton's identities and proves the converse direction needed: power sum agreement implies coefficient agreement. This classical result from polynomial algebra is indispensable for connecting root properties to polynomial identity.

Getting Started

Prerequisites: Lean 4 (v4.25.0-rc2), basic familiarity with polynomials, complex numbers, and trigonometric identities.

Clone the repository and build the project:

git clone https://github.com/e-vergo/ChebyshevCircles.git
cd ChebyshevCircles
lake exe cache get
lake build

Read the research paper for traditional mathematical exposition, explore the Blueprint for an interactive map of the formalization, check the API Documentation for detailed proofs, or view the Dependency Graph to understand the proof structure.

Acknowledgments & Inspiration

🎓 Early Visualization

The Girls' Angle blog post "Chebyshev Polynomials of the First Kind" (December 2016) appears to be the first published visualization and animation of this geometric connection between rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev polynomials.

This foundational work demonstrated the visual beauty of the relationship years before this formal verification.

Prior Art

💡 Initial Inspiration

A Mastodon post by @acegikmo (November 2022) on visual patterns in rotated roots of unity sparked the investigation that led to this formalization.

Sometimes the most profound mathematical journeys begin with a single compelling visualization shared on social media.

Inspiration Source

The formalization is structured across 10 modules (3,498 lines total). Each module's API documentation contains the complete, type-checked Lean code:

  • RootsOfUnity (108 lines) - Root definitions and list properties
  • PolynomialConstruction (541 lines) - Polynomial construction from roots
  • TrigonometricIdentities (137 lines) - Trigonometric sum identities
  • ChebyshevRoots (235 lines) - Chebyshev root characterization
  • PowerSums (705 lines) - Power sum φ-invariance
  • NewtonIdentities (317 lines) - Newton's identities framework
  • PolynomialProperties (130 lines) - Polynomial degree and coefficient properties
  • PowerSumEquality (273 lines) - General power sum equality
  • ChebyshevOrthogonality (538 lines) - Discrete orthogonality relations
  • MainTheorem (473 lines) - Main theorem and supporting results

Quick Links to Major Results

Main Theorem: API Docs | Blueprint §1

Power Sum Invariance (φ-independence): API Docs | Blueprint §4

Discrete Orthogonality: sum_exp_chebyshev_angles | Module Docs | Blueprint §5

Newton's Identities Application: esymm_eq_of_psum_eq | Module Docs | Blueprint §6

Visual Proof Structure: The dependency graph provides an interactive visualization of all 200+ definitions, lemmas, and theorems, showing how foundational results in discrete orthogonality and polynomial algebra combine to establish the main theorem.

Proof Strategy

The verification establishes that rotated roots and Chebyshev roots share identical power sums for all positive degrees, which by Newton's identities implies they generate polynomials differing only by a constant term. This approach reduces the geometric claim to an algebraic invariant (power sums), then applies classical polynomial algebra to reach the conclusion.

Critical Proofs

Power Sum Invariance (powerSumCos_invariant): The cornerstone of the entire proof. This establishes that ∑cosm(φ + 2πk/N) is independent of the rotation angle φ for all m ≥ 1. The proof exploits the fact that cos(θ) = (eiθ + e-iθ)/2, converting cosine powers into sums of complex exponentials. These exponential sums telescope to zero by discrete orthogonality unless specific divisibility conditions hold, yielding the φ-independence. Without this result, there would be no connection between rotated roots and Chebyshev polynomials.

Discrete Orthogonality (ChebyshevOrthogonality module): Proves that ∑k=0N-1 exp(2πikm/N) = 0 for 0 < m < N and equals N when m = 0 or N divides m (see sum_exp_chebyshev_angles, sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes). This is the discrete analog of continuous Fourier orthogonality on the circle. The proof uses properties of geometric series and the fact that N-th roots of unity satisfy ωN = 1. This orthogonality is what causes most terms in the power sum expansion to vanish, leaving only the φ-independent contributions. It connects harmonic analysis (orthogonality relations) to polynomial root behavior.

Newton's Identities (NewtonIdentities module): Establishes the relationship between power sums of roots and elementary symmetric polynomials (coefficients) via multiset_newton_identity. Specifically, if two monic polynomials have roots with matching power sums S1, S2, ..., SN, then the polynomials have identical coefficients except possibly the constant term (esymm_eq_of_psum_eq). This is the bridge that converts power sum equality into polynomial equality up to a constant. The formalization handles the recursive structure of Newton's identities and proves the converse direction needed: power sum agreement implies coefficient agreement. This classical result from polynomial algebra is indispensable for connecting root properties to polynomial identity.

Getting Started

Prerequisites: Lean 4 (v4.25.0-rc2), basic familiarity with polynomials, complex numbers, and trigonometric identities.

Clone the repository and build the project:

git clone https://github.com/e-vergo/ChebyshevCircles.git
cd ChebyshevCircles
lake exe cache get
lake build

Read the research paper for traditional mathematical exposition, explore the Blueprint for an interactive map of the formalization, check the API Documentation for detailed proofs, or view the Dependency Graph to understand the proof structure.

Acknowledgments & Inspiration

🎓 Early Visualization

The Girls' Angle blog post "Chebyshev Polynomials of the First Kind" (December 2016) appears to be the first published visualization and animation of this geometric connection between rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev polynomials.

This foundational work demonstrated the visual beauty of the relationship years before this formal verification.

Prior Art

💡 Initial Inspiration

A Mastodon post by @acegikmo (November 2022) on visual patterns in rotated roots of unity sparked the investigation that led to this formalization.

Sometimes the most profound mathematical journeys begin with a single compelling visualization shared on social media.

Chebyshev Circles

Blueprint Paper (PDF) API Docs Dependency Graph GitHub

Rotated Roots of Unity and Chebyshev Polynomials

Rotating the N-th roots of unity by angle φ and projecting them onto the real axis yields N points. The polynomial with these projections as roots, when scaled by 2N-1, equals the N-th Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind plus a constant that depends on φ.

Main Theorem

theorem rotated_roots_yield_chebyshev (N : ℕ) (φ : ℝ) (hN : 0 < N) :
  ∃ (c : ℝ), scaledPolynomial N φ = Polynomial.Chebyshev.T ℝ N + C c

View theorem statement in API docs →

Construction:
  • Projected roots: cos(φ + 2πk/N) for k = 0, ..., N-1 (blueprint §2)
  • Unscaled polynomial: P(x) = ∏(x - cos(φ + 2πk/N)) (blueprint §3)
  • Scaled polynomial: S(x) = 2N-1 · P(x) (blueprint §3)
  • Result: S(x) = TN(x) + c(φ) (blueprint §1)

content.text:
## Analysis Complete

I've identified the root cause of the 45-minute CI failure:

**The Problem:**
- Workflow step "Copy blueprint to deployment directory" fails at line 200
- It checks for `blueprint/src/web/` but leanblueprint actually outputs to `blueprint/web/`
- Both directories are gitignored (different .gitignore files)

**Timeline:**
- Run started: 00:49:19Z
- "Check declarations" step: 9 minutes (succeeded)  
- "Copy blueprint" step: FAILED at 01:57:20
- Total runtime: ~68 minutes before failure

**Root Cause:**
1. `blueprint/src/plastex.cfg` specifies output `directory=../web/` (which is `blueprint/web/`)
2. Workflow incorrectly checks for `blueprint/src/web/` (line 200)
3. In CI, `leanblueprint web` generates files in `blueprint/web/`
4. Copy step fails because `blueprint/src/web/` doesn't exist or is empty

**Why This Surfaced Now:**
- Prior to commit `ffe94e3` (Enable full documentation deployment), build-full only ran manually
- After `ffe94e3`, build-full runs on every push to main
- This exposed the mismatch between blueprint output location and workflow expectations

**The Fix:**
Change line 200 in `.github/workflows/deploy.yml` from:
```yaml
if [ -d "blueprint/src/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/src/web)" ]; then
  cp -r blueprint/src/web/* _site/blueprint/
```
to:
```yaml
if [ -d "blueprint/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/web)" ]; then
  cp -r blueprint/web/* _site/blueprint/
```

Ready to implement the fix?

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: Build and Deploy Documentation

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_mode:
        description: 'Build mode'
        required: false
        default: 'full'
        type: choice
        options:
          - quick
          - full

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Quick validation - runs first to fail fast
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 15
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get

      - name: Build Lean project (fail fast)
        run: lake build

  # Fast build - just landing page and GIFs
  build-landing:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied successfully"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List landing page contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Landing page deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f

      - name: Upload landing page artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Deploy landing page (only for quick workflow on manual trigger with build_mode='quick')
  deploy-landing:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'quick'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-landing
    steps:
      - name: Deploy landing page to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Full build - everything including docs and blueprint
  # Runs on every push to main, or manual workflow_dispatch with build_mode='full'
  build-full:
    if: (github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push') || (github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full')
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get || true

      - name: Build Lean project
        run: lake build

      # Build API Documentation
      - name: Build API documentation
        run: |
          # Build documentation using the correct command
          lake build ChebyshevCircles:docs
          # doc-gen4 outputs to .lake/build/doc
          mkdir -p _site/docs
          if [ -d ".lake/build/doc" ]; then
            cp -r .lake/build/doc/* _site/docs/
            echo "API documentation built successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: API documentation not found after build"
            exit 1
          fi

      # Build Blueprint
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
          cache: 'pip'

      - name: Install system dependencies
        run: |
          sudo apt-get update
          sudo apt-get install -y graphviz libgraphviz-dev \
            texlive-latex-base \
            texlive-latex-extra \
            texlive-fonts-recommended \
            texlive-fonts-extra \
            texlive-science \
            texlive-xetex \
            latexmk

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: pip install -r blueprint/requirements.txt

      - name: Patch plastexdepgraph for hashable nodes
        run: python3 .github/scripts/patch_plastexdepgraph.py

      - name: Build blueprint (web)
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint web
          echo "=== Blueprint web build output ==="
          ls -la src/web/ || echo "WARNING: web directory not found"
          find src/web -type f | head -20 || true

      - name: Build blueprint (pdf)
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint pdf || echo "PDF generation failed, continuing with web version only"
          echo "=== Blueprint PDF build output ==="
          ls -la print/ || echo "WARNING: print directory not found"
          if [ -f "print/print.pdf" ]; then
            echo "PDF successfully generated: $(ls -lh print/print.pdf)"
          else
            echo "PDF not generated"
          fi

      - name: Check declarations
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint checkdecls || echo "Some declarations could not be verified"

      - name: Copy blueprint to deployment directory
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/blueprint
          if [ -d "blueprint/src/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/src/web)" ]; then
            cp -r blueprint/src/web/* _site/blueprint/
            echo "Blueprint web files copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Blueprint web build not found or empty"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create dependency graph redirect page
        run: |
          # Create redirect page to blueprint's interactive dependency graph
          bash .github/scripts/create_graph_page.sh _site/graph
          echo "Dependency graph redirect page created (points to /blueprint/dep_graph_document.html)"

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied to full deployment"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List full deployment contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Full deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f | head -50

      - name: Upload full site artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-full'

  # Deploy full site
  deploy-full:
    if: (github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push') || (github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full')
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-full
    steps:
      - name: Deploy full site to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-full'

content.content:
Chebyshev Circles Blueprint

Eric Vergo

1 Introduction

PDF Version: A compiled PDF version of this blueprint is available at print/blueprint.pdf.

The Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind, denoted \(T_N(x)\), form one of the most important families of orthogonal polynomials, with applications spanning approximation theory, numerical analysis, and harmonic analysis. These polynomials are typically defined either through the trigonometric identity

\begin{equation} T_N(\cos \theta ) = \cos (N\theta ), \end{equation}
1

or via the three-term recurrence relation

\begin{equation} T_0(x) = 1, \quad T_1(x) = x, \quad T_{n+1}(x) = 2xT_n(x) - T_{n-1}(x). \end{equation}
2

In this project, we present a novel geometric construction of Chebyshev polynomials using rotated roots of unity. Consider the \(N\)-th roots of unity on the complex unit circle:

\begin{equation} \omega _k = \mathrm{e}^{2\pi i k/N}, \quad k = 0, 1, \ldots , N-1. \end{equation}
3

These form a regular \(N\)-gon inscribed in the unit circle, with vertices equally spaced at angular intervals of \(2\pi /N\).

Definition 1.0.1 Rotated roots
✓
#

Lean declarations

  • realProjection_eq_cos
  • realProjection_mem_Icc

content.thinking:
Interesting! So the dependency graph works on first load but breaks on subsequent visits in the same session. This is a classic symptom of:

1. **State management issue** - Some JavaScript state isn't being properly reset when navigating back
2. **Browser back/forward cache (bfcache)** - The page is being restored from cache without re-executing initialization scripts
3. **Event listener or worker cleanup issue** - The d3-graphviz library uses Web Workers (`useWorker: true`), and these might not be properly cleaned up/reinitialized

Let me investigate the dependency graph implementation to understand what's happening.

The key line from the HTML:
```javascript
graphContainer.graphviz({useWorker: true})
    .renderDot(`...`)
```

When you navigate away and come back:
- Browser might restore the page from bfcache
- The Web Worker might be in a bad state
- The d3-graphviz initialization might not re-run
- The graph container might already have content that blocks re-rendering

Solutions:
1. Add a `pageshow` event listener to re-initialize the graph
2. Force graph re-render on navigation back
3. Clean up workers on page unload
4. Disable bfcache for this page (not recommended)
5. Check if container has content and clear it before rendering

I should check the actual implementation in the blueprint/web/dep_graph_document.html to see how it's currently set up.

content.text:
Good catch! This is a browser back/forward cache (bfcache) issue. When you navigate back, the page is restored from cache but the d3-graphviz Web Worker isn't being re-initialized properly.

content.thinking:
I see the issue. The graph is initialized immediately when the script runs, but when you navigate back using browser back button, the page is restored from bfcache (back/forward cache), and:

1. The script doesn't re-run
2. The Web Worker state from `useWorker: true` is stale
3. The graph container might have leftover state

The solution is to add a `pageshow` event listener that detects when the page is restored from cache and re-initializes the graph. The `pageshow` event fires both on initial load and when navigating back to a cached page. We can detect if it's from cache using `event.persisted`.

I need to wrap the graph initialization in a function and call it both on initial load and on pageshow from cache.

content.text:
Found it! The graph initialization runs once on load but doesn't re-initialize when you navigate back. The browser's back/forward cache (bfcache) restores the page but the d3-graphviz Web Worker is in a stale state.

**The Fix:** Wrap the graph initialization in a function and call it on both initial load and when returning from cache:

name: Build and Deploy Documentation

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      build_mode:
        description: 'Build mode'
        required: false
        default: 'full'
        type: choice
        options:
          - quick
          - full

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: "pages"
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  # Quick validation - runs first to fail fast
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 15
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get

      - name: Build Lean project (fail fast)
        run: lake build

  # Fast build - just landing page and GIFs
  build-landing:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied successfully"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List landing page contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Landing page deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f

      - name: Upload landing page artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Deploy landing page (only for quick workflow on manual trigger with build_mode='quick')
  deploy-landing:
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'quick'
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-landing
    steps:
      - name: Deploy landing page to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-landing'

  # Full build - everything including docs and blueprint
  # Runs on every push to main, or manual workflow_dispatch with build_mode='full'
  build-full:
    if: (github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push') || (github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full')
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    needs: validate
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install Lean
        uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1
        with:
          auto-build: false

      - name: Get Lean build cache
        run: lake exe cache get || true

      - name: Build Lean project
        run: lake build

      # Build API Documentation
      - name: Build API documentation
        run: |
          # Build documentation using the correct command
          lake build ChebyshevCircles:docs
          # doc-gen4 outputs to .lake/build/doc
          mkdir -p _site/docs
          if [ -d ".lake/build/doc" ]; then
            cp -r .lake/build/doc/* _site/docs/
            echo "API documentation built successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: API documentation not found after build"
            exit 1
          fi

      # Build Blueprint
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
          cache: 'pip'

      - name: Install system dependencies
        run: |
          sudo apt-get update
          sudo apt-get install -y graphviz libgraphviz-dev \
            texlive-latex-base \
            texlive-latex-extra \
            texlive-fonts-recommended \
            texlive-fonts-extra \
            texlive-science \
            texlive-xetex \
            latexmk

      - name: Install Python dependencies
        run: pip install -r blueprint/requirements.txt

      - name: Patch plastexdepgraph for hashable nodes
        run: python3 .github/scripts/patch_plastexdepgraph.py

      - name: Build blueprint (web)
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint web
          echo "=== Blueprint web build output ==="
          ls -la src/web/ || echo "WARNING: web directory not found"
          find src/web -type f | head -20 || true

      - name: Build blueprint (pdf)
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint pdf || echo "PDF generation failed, continuing with web version only"
          echo "=== Blueprint PDF build output ==="
          ls -la print/ || echo "WARNING: print directory not found"
          if [ -f "print/print.pdf" ]; then
            echo "PDF successfully generated: $(ls -lh print/print.pdf)"
          else
            echo "PDF not generated"
          fi

      - name: Check declarations
        continue-on-error: true
        run: |
          cd blueprint
          leanblueprint checkdecls || echo "Some declarations could not be verified"

      - name: Copy blueprint to deployment directory
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/blueprint
          if [ -d "blueprint/web" ] && [ "$(ls -A blueprint/web)" ]; then
            cp -r blueprint/web/* _site/blueprint/
            echo "Blueprint web files copied successfully"
          else
            echo "ERROR: Blueprint web build not found or empty"
            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Create dependency graph redirect page
        run: |
          # Create redirect page to blueprint's interactive dependency graph
          bash .github/scripts/create_graph_page.sh _site/graph
          echo "Dependency graph redirect page created (points to /blueprint/dep_graph_document.html)"

      - name: Copy static landing page
        run: |
          cp index.html _site/
          echo "Static landing page copied to full deployment"

      - name: Copy visualization videos
        run: |
          if [ -d "chebyshev_videos" ]; then
            cp -r chebyshev_videos _site/
            echo "Visualization videos copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Chebyshev videos directory not found"
          fi

      - name: Copy paper PDF
        run: |
          mkdir -p _site/paper
          if [ -f "paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf" ]; then
            cp paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf _site/paper/
            echo "Paper PDF copied successfully"
          else
            echo "WARNING: Paper PDF not found at paper/chebyshev_circles.pdf"
          fi

      - name: List full deployment contents
        run: |
          echo "=== Full deployment structure ==="
          find _site -type f | head -50

      - name: Upload full site artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: '_site'
          name: 'github-pages-full'

  # Deploy full site
  deploy-full:
    if: (github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' && github.event_name == 'push') || (github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' && inputs.build_mode == 'full')
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build-full
    steps:
      - name: Deploy full site to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
        with:
          artifact_name: 'github-pages-full'

content.text:
Done! Here's what I found and fixed:

## Problem Diagnosed ✓
**Dependency graph breaks on browser back navigation**
- Works perfectly on first visit
- Breaks when you navigate away and come back in the same session
- Root cause: Browser **back/forward cache (bfcache)** restores the page from memory but doesn't re-run the d3-graphviz initialization script
- The Web Worker used by d3-graphviz (`useWorker: true`) ends up in a stale state

## Solution Implemented ✓
Created `.github/scripts/fix_dep_graph_bfcache.py` that:
1. **Wraps graph initialization** in a reusable function
2. **Clears the graph container** before each render (prevents duplicates)
3. **Adds a `pageshow` event listener** that detects when page is restored from cache
4. **Re-initializes the graph** automatically when you navigate back

The fix is integrated into the CI workflow and runs after `leanblueprint web` builds the graph, before deployment.

## What Happens Now
✅ Committed: `8ce64b1`
✅ Pushed to main
⏳ CI is building (~35-45 min total)
🚀 Fix will be live at: https://e-vergo.github.io/ChebyshevCircles/blueprint/dep_graph_document.html

## How to Verify After Deployment
1. Visit the dependency graph
2. Navigate away (e.g., click a node modal, then close it, or go to blueprint index)
3. Use browser back button
4. **Expected:** Graph re-renders automatically (you'll see a brief flash as it clears and re-draws)
5. **Console log:** Opens browser console (F12), you'll see "Page restored from cache, re-initializing graph"

The fix ensures the graph works consistently regardless of how you navigate to/from the page. Let me know once CI completes and I'll help verify it's working!

#!/bin/bash
# Create blueprint redirect page
# NOTE: dep_graph_document.html is not currently being generated by plastexdepgraph
# despite having dep_graph option enabled in web.tex. This appears to be a known
# issue with the current blueprint setup. Redirecting to blueprint index instead.

set -e

OUTPUT_DIR="$1"

if [ -z "$OUTPUT_DIR" ]; then
    echo "Usage: create_graph_page.sh <output_dir>"
    exit 1
fi

mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"

# Create redirect page to the blueprint's interactive dependency graph
cat > "$OUTPUT_DIR/index.html" << 'EOF'
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; url=../blueprint/index.html">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Redirecting to Blueprint...</title>

#!/bin/bash
# Create dependency graph redirect page

set -e

OUTPUT_DIR="$1"

if [ -z "$OUTPUT_DIR" ]; then
    echo "Usage: create_graph_page.sh <output_dir>"
    exit 1
fi

mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"

# Create redirect page to the blueprint's interactive dependency graph
cat > "$OUTPUT_DIR/index.html" << 'EOF'
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; url=../blueprint/dep_graph_document.html">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Redirecting to Dependency Graph...</title>

-# despite having dep_graph option enabled in web.tex. This appears to be a known
-# issue with the current blueprint setup. Redirecting to blueprint index instead.
